alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued February 26 at 10:44AM MST until February 27 at 12:00AM MST by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MST TONIGHT... * WHAT...West winds 45 to 55 mph with gusts up to 85 mph expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central New Mexico and southwest Texas. This includes Hudspeth county in west Texas, the Sacramento mountains of south central New Mexico, and the lowlands west of the Guadalupe mountains in Otero county. * WHEN...From 9 AM Sunday to midnight MST Sunday night. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are expected. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Local areas of blowing dust will reduce visibilities and make travel dangerous across some of the lower elevations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The strongest winds and wind gusts will occur over exposed ridges, through passes, and over areas east of high ridges.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet
